item.title: Why You May Want to Hold Off on the Latest Call of Duty Xbox Sale
item.description:
Highlights

  • Wait to buy discounted Call of Duty games on Xbox because Xbox Game Pass may offer them soon.
  • Xbox owns all Activision games, so Call of Duty could soon be included in Game Pass.
  • Rumors suggest classic Call of Duty games may be added to Xbox Game Pass as early as June 2024.

Xbox is currently hosting a sale that heavily discounts Call of Duty games, but since all these titles are likely to come to Xbox Game Pass in the near future, it may be best not to buy them. Xbox's acquisition of Activision Blizzard means that the company now owns all the games published by the company. In turn, this means Xbox is free to bring said titles, like Call of Duty , to its Xbox Game Pass subscription service.

Xbox Game Pass has been key to Xbox's strategy in recent years, with the company doing whatever it possibly can to bring in new subscribers. Xbox Game Pass subscribers enjoy exclusive benefits and discounts , plus they get access to a huge library of games that is updated regularly. Brand-new, day one releases come to Xbox Game Pass all the time, but the service is also home to plenty of older games. And soon, it will most likely be a one-stop destination for the vast majority of games in the Call of Duty series.

Related
Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Leak Could Be Good News for Xbox One and PS4 Gamers

A recent Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 leak contains information that may excite fans of the Xbox One and PlayStation 4 consoles.

Call of Duty coming to Xbox Game Pass is only a matter of time, which is why Xbox gamers may want to hold off on buying the Call of Duty games that are part of the console's latest sales promotion. Currently, the vast majority of Call of Duty games can be purchased on Xbox for less than $20, with the most recent entry in the series, the 2023 version of Modern Warfare 3 , discounted to $45.49. In total, gamers would have to spend around $350 to buy all the discounted Call of Duty games, or they could just sign up for Game Pass for a fraction of that price and soon have access to all the CoD s and the many other games that are part of the service.

Xbox Call of Duty Sale Prices

  • Call of Duty 2 - $9.99
  • Call of Duty 3 - $9.99
  • Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare - $9.99
  • Call of Duty: World at War - $9.99
  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 - $9.99
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops - $14.99
  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 - $14.99
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 2 - $14.99
  • Call of Duty: Ghosts - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare Remastered - $19.99
  • Call of Duty: WW2 - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops Cold War - $19.79
  • Call of Duty: Vanguard - $23.99
  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 (2022) - $34.99
  • Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 3 (2023) - $45.49

Now, it should be stressed that plans to bring Call of Duty to Xbox Game Pass have yet to be announced. However, it's telling that the Xbox Activision Blizzard Sale wraps up just before the Xbox Games Showcase on June 9. Rumors have suggested that Xbox will announce its plans to bring classic Call of Duty games to Game Pass as part of the June 9 showcase, where fans can also expect to get their first proper look at the franchise's 2024 release, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 .

There were conflicting reports about whether Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 would be a day one Xbox Game Pass game or not, but the latest word is that it will indeed make its debut on the subscription. This means that it's highly likely that anyone signed up for Xbox Game Pass will have access to basically every main series Call of Duty game in existence by the end of the year, with one exception.

At the time of this writing, the only Call of Duty game that is not backward compatible on Xbox is Call of Duty Classic , the revamped version of the very first game in the series. It's possible that the original will one day make its return to Xbox, but regardless, Game Pass subscribers should have more Call of Duty than they know what to do with soon enough.

item.title: Mad Max Dev Defends Game After George Miller Comments
item.description:
Highlights

  • Avalanche Studios CEO defended the Mad Max video game adaptation against criticisms from the film franchise director.
  • Players praised the game's setting and combat, but opinions on its story and characters were varied.
  • The likelihood of Hideo Kojima developing next Mad Max game seems unlikely due to ongoing projects.

The CEO of Avalanche Studios, the developer behind the most recent Mad Max game, has spoken out about comments made by George Miller, the creator and director of the Mad Max film franchise. While on the red carpet for the premiere of Furiosa: A Mad Max Saga, Miller stated that he would like Hideo Kojima to be the developer of the next Mad Max video game adaptation, if there ever is one.

Mad Max the game was released in September 2015 and received mixed reviews. While it currently sits at an “Overwhelmingly Positive” user rating on Steam, it has a 69 critic average on OpenCritic and a similar score on Metacritic. Players praised the game’s setting and combat, but opinions on its story and cast of characters were varied. Generally, it was agreed that Avalanche succeeded in replicating the unwelcoming atmosphere of the Mad Max films, though some people felt that the open world and locations were a bit too plain and repetitive.

Related
7 Best Open-World Games Based On Movie Franchises, Ranked

Whether set in the worlds established by movies or as direct movie-tie-ins, these games presented open worlds as memorable as the movies themselves.

George Miller apparently fell into the category of people who weren't satisfied with the 2015 Mad Max video game . The director stated that the adaptation “wasn’t as good as I wanted it to be,” despite the film studio giving “all of our material to a company to do it.” Christofer Sundberg, CEO of Avalanche Studios, understandably took umbrage with Miller’s comments. The developer stated on social media that the remark was “complete nonsense and just shows complete arrogance.”

Avalanche Studios Defends Its Mad Max Game Adapation

According to Sundberg, the film studio wanted to make the game adaptation linear even though Avalanche was an established creator of open-world titles. The Swedish development studio had already released two well-received Just Cause games and was working on a third, as well as two entries in theHunter franchise and Renegade Ops, a vehicular combat experience with RPG elements. Despite his consternation at Miller’s comments, Sundberg agreed that Hideo Kojima would make an “awesome Mad Max game, but it would be a completely different experience.” And perhaps that’s what Miller is hoping for.

However, the likelihood of Kojima taking the reins of a Mad Max game adaptation seems unlikely, at least in the near future. The esteemed video game director is undoubtedly hard at work on Death Stranding 2 , which has just finished shooting and recording with the cast. Kojima Productions is now moving on to the game’s adjustment phase, which will focus on gameplay and graphics and is expected to take about a year to complete.

Other game developers have defended Avalanche, including Larian Studios’ Michael Douse , who pointed out that the game developer didn’t have early access to Mad Max: Fury Road, the film that came out four months before the game. And due to the aforementioned disagreement over linear versus open-world gameplay, Mad Max ’s direction was rebooted a year into development. Despite this, many people consider Avalanche’s Mad Max to be the best game adaptation of the franchise thus far.

item.title: 5 Best Water Characters In Solo Leveling:ARISE, Ranked
item.description:
Highlights

  • Elements play a crucial role in Solo Leveling: ARISE , with Water characters having unique abilities like Freeze and shield-breaking.
  • Invest wisely in Water characters like Seo Jiwoo, who excels as a tank and breaker, while others like Han Song-Yi may not perform as well.
  • Understanding elements and character strengths is key to changing the tide of battles in the game, helping players progress effectively.

Elements are a common theme in many games. This theme is especially common in gacha games, where a certain element is associated with the characters that players can control. The elements in Solo Leveling:ARISE play an important role in the game and, without proper knowledge of these elements, it can backfire on players. With correct elements used in every stage, players can change the tide of the battle in their favor.

Related
Genshin Impact: Every Playable Hydro User, Ranked

Among the elemental abilities in Genshin Impact, Hydro can be a bit tricky to work with. Knowing the best playable Hydro users in the game can help!

ARISE has five elements, Water being one of them. Each element is associated with a theme, and characters using the Water element have the power to control their movements precisely. Hunters with the power of Water can apply status effects like Freeze to stop enemies in their tracks. While the game is new and there aren’t many Water characters available as of this writing, this list ranks all the Water characters currently in the game to help players decides which ones to invest in.

5 Han Song-Yi

Poison That Helps The Team

  • Class: Assassin
  • Scaling: Attack

Han Song-Yi , at the time of writing, is the worst Water character available in the game. This Assassin hunter can do some decent damage to enemies, but there are better Water options in the game that can do better than her.

Han Song-Yi can poison her target with a 100% uptime on her skill if used correctly, which makes her a good option in DoT teams. Apart from this, Han is not very impressive, as she does mediocre damage to enemies, which makes it hard to justify investing in order to build her. However, players who like her character design and her gameplay should still try her out, as not everything in the game has to work according to the meta.

4 Anna Ruiz

Break Shields Full-Time

  • Class: Ranger
  • Scaling: Attack

Anna Ruiz is a SR Water-type hunter in Solo Leveling:ARISE who belongs to the Ranger class. While Anna might not be the most impressive Water-type character in the game, her status changes when she crosses Advancement Level 3. Anna works well with other DoT characters, and can be used as a shield breaker in teams thanks to her passive skill.

Related
Honkai: Star Rail – Every Preservation Character, Ranked

To shield and protect is the primary role of Preservation characters in Honkai: Star Rail.

Her passive ability gives her a chance to deal 100 break damage and additional damage equal to 30% of her attack for every 3 seconds, for 30 seconds, if one of Anna’s skills hits her target. With Advancement Level 3, she can also decrease the target's defense while breaking their shield, making her quite useful in certain situations. Players having multiple dupes of Anna lying in their roster should try her out in dungeons to see if she works well for them.

3 Lee Joohe

Maximum Healing

  • Class: Healer
  • Scaling: HP

Lee Joohe is an all-out healer in the game that provides rapid healing to her team members. This SR Healer uses the power of the Water element to heal allies and prevent their deaths on the battlefield. Lee Joohe is built in a way that provides great healing, which can be utilized by players until the endgame content.

However, Lee Joohe has her own limitations as a character. While her healing is strong, she fails when it comes to damage-dealing abilities, and her damage multipliers are worse than any SR character in the game. Lee Joohe is a free unit, so players can obtain her without the gacha, and players looking for an exclusive healer might find their answer with her on the team.

2 Nam Chae-Young

Break And Freeze

  • Class: Ranger
  • Scaling: HP

For an SR unit, Nam Chae-Young displays excellent potential as a damage-dealer for the team, and can even break enemy shields . She has either a medium or heavy break effect associated with all her skills, which works greatly to drive through enemy defenses.

Related
Monster Hunter Rise: How to Get Freezer Sac

Freezer Sacs are one of the many crafting components players are expected to acquire in order to craft some of the gear in Monster Hunter Rise.

Apart from her ability to shred shields, Nam can freeze enemies with most of her skills for 2 seconds, and her passive ability works in harmony with this. Nam's passive allows her to deal 20% more damage to the frozen targets, making her a great pick for a team, where players can deal heavy damage to enemies and bosses alike without the risk of being attacked by them.

1 Seo Jiwoo

Can Complete Dungeons Solo

  • Class : Tank
  • Scaling : HP

Seo Jiwoo is hands down the best Water character, if not one of the best characters overall in Solo Leveling:ARISE. Being a tank character, Seo Jiwoo is able to withstand enemy attacks thanks to her large HP reserves and her shield-making ability. Jiwoo is so strong that players can use her solo in the dungeons without any worry.

Her skills are absolutely broken. Most of her skills when used provide the team with a shield. The break damage she deals increases when using Lightning Kick, one of her basic attacks, making her one of the best breakers in the game. Her passive allows her to reset the cooldown on her basic skills and make them more powerful, allowing her to stay on the field for a long time without swapping. Because Jiwoo scales with max HP, it is easier to build her as well and, with all her broken abilities, Seo Jiwoo is one of the best available allies and team members against any monster.

item.title: Resident Evil Falling Back on Legacy Characters Already Would Be a Shame
item.description:
Highlights

  • Ethan's sacrifice in Village ties up his story, but the Shadows of Rose DLC hints at more mysteries with Rose's powers.
  • Mia's shady past as a bioweapon researcher should not be forgotten; her connections to The Connections need to be explored.
  • A balance between original characters like Chris and newcomers like Rose is key for the next installment in the Resident Evil series.

The final events of Village saw the story of Resident Evil come full circle as the beginnings of Umbrella were revealed. After Resident Evil 7 and Village took new protagonist Ethan Winters on a harrowing journey to find his missing wife Mia and their child Rose, the next Resident Evil game would make a mistake by dropping these characters completely.

Although Ethan ultimately sacrifices his own life at the end of Village to save his wife and child, the series offers a follow-up story with the Shadows of Rose DLC. This DLC follows a now-teenage Rose as she figures out how to live with her superhuman abilities, and provides a little more insight into the Winters family. However, if rumors are to be believed, and the next Resident Evil game focuses more on the series' past characters, it would be a letdown.

Related
Resident Evil 4 Remake is All The Proof Needed That an Open-World Approach Can Work

It's been heavily rumored that Resident Evil 9 will be adopting an open-world structure, and Resident Evil 4 Remake laid some nice foundations.

Resident Evil 9 Shouldn't Completely Ditch the Winters Saga

Rose and Her Special Powers

The franchise's legacy characters definitely need to start making a comeback to the overall series, but that doesn't mean the franchise's newest additions to Resident Evil 's roster have to be dropped completely. Ethan may be long gone, but there are still plenty of questions surrounding Rose and Mia, especially the former. Rose and her superhuman abilities can't just be swept under the rug, and if Resident Evil 9 chooses to avoid giving more answers to her nature, the game already runs the risk of failing to give satisfying closure.

These powers that Rose was born with hold huge implications for the broader Resident Evil universe. Furthermore, this also puts Rose in the position to be a compelling character who could teeter on the fine line between hero and villain. Such great power could potentially corrupt her into being the next big villain, or she could use it to assist Chris Redfield and his unit, especially since it seems like he's become her caretaker.

Mia's Shady Past

Ethan's wife, Mia, is a character who seems to have been completely forgotten in the grand scheme of things. In Resident Evil 7 , she disappears after things go wrong while she's on assignment caring for the bioweapon Eveline. Mia is an operative and researcher for The Connections, a crime organization that is focused on creating various bioweapons. So, technically, Mia is a terrorist, and that's too compelling of an angle to just completely forget.

Also, Mia is nowhere to be found in the Shadows of Rose DLC. There's no clear answer as to her whereabouts in the DLC, which is a shame since she could have so many answers about The Connections and their inner workings. As the franchise moves forward, the storyline that Resident Evil 7 and Village established has far too much potential to just set aside, and they need to continue with the characters that brought it to life in the first place.

Bringing Original Characters and Newcomers Together

It feels highly likely that one or multiple characters from the original Resident Evil trilogy will be making their way back into the franchise, but they need to work in tandem with the newcomers. Chris Redfield is the branch that connects both the old games and the new era, so it's not impossible to have the best of both worlds. Bringing Jill or Leon back while also exploring Rose and Mia's lives doesn't have to be mutually exclusive. It will be exciting to see which direction Resident Evil will go with its next installment, but the franchise hopefully won't drop the ball after presenting such a compelling storyline in the past two games.

item.title: Wuthering Waves is Already a Massive Hit
item.description:
Highlights

  • Wuthering Waves tops charts in 100 regions post-launch, meeting high expectations of many players.
  • The game has been praised for combat and exploration, as well as the developers' willingness to listen to feedback.
  • Despite technical issues, Kuro Games' daily hotfixes maintain the game's momentum as upcoming updates promise more content.

Less than a week after its highly anticipated launch, Wuthering Waves reached the top of the charts in over 100 regions. With over 30 million players pre-registered before the game's debut, many users expected that Kuro Games' open-world action RPG would become one of the biggest releases for the free-to-play gacha game genre in recent memory. Wuthering Waves has since met those expectations and garnered a sizable fanbase of players, who have endlessly praised the title for its stylish gameplay and smooth exploration mechanics.

While it was only released on May 22, Wuthering Waves has been at the center of the gacha gaming community for quite some time now. Since it was first announced, the title's marketing was predominantly focused on Wuthering Waves ' spectacular combat and fast-paced traversal mechanics, which set it apart from its direct competitors. The closed-beta tests additionally fostered even more excitement for its release. Fans praised Kuro Games' latest project and the developers' willingness to listen to their player base's feedback, with the team behind Wuthering Waves even reportedly rewriting most of the script for the game in response to criticisms from the first closed beta test.

Related
Wuthering Waves: All 5-Star Characters, Ranked

5-star characters still need to compete against each other to be crowned the best Resonator in Wuthering Waves.

Fortunately for the developers, their work has paid off, as Wuthering Waves now sits at the top of the charts of over 100 territories. The official Wuthering Waves Twitter account confirmed the game's phenomenal launch in a post, which also included a message expressing the heartfelt appreciation of the studio for its fans' continued support. New Wuthering Waves players similarly celebrated the game's success, with users sharing their love for the game and praise for the work done by Kuro Games' developers.

Wuthering Waves Devs Apologize for Shaky Launch

Though the game is an extraordinary triumph for Kuro Games, Wuthering Waves is still dealing with a few hiccups along the road. Hundreds of players previously reported technical issues with everything ranging from graphical textures to overall stability, leading to Kuro Games offering in-game compensation and apologizing for the game's shaky state. Thankfully, developers have also continued to roll out daily hotfixes since release, and Wuthering Waves retains respectable scores of 4.3 and 4.4 stars on the Google Play and App stores respectively.

It remains to be seen how much of its initial player base will stick with Wuthering Waves , but for those who do stay, Kuro Games' open-world gacha game already offers a vast amount of content to keep them engaged. Wuthering Waves ' upcoming banners additionally hold the promise of more characters with unique move sets and abilities to keep players engaged, such as the highly anticipated Yinlin who is set to come out on June 12.
